name: Probes Reporter¬Æ
tweet: A lot of talk the SEC is supposedly asleep at the switch.  Yet we regularly acquire records from investigations that were not disclosed, many serious.   Having said that, we do think the SEC would benefit from bringing in more people with capital markets experience / expertise.

name: Probes Reporter¬Æ
tweet: When the PCAOB was initially set up, the audit profession made sure it was not subject to the #FOIA.  It served no public interest to do so.  We still live with those consequences today.

name: Probes Reporter¬Æ
tweet: Fraud runs in cycles. Just like the importance of accounting.  Neither matter until they do. Then it's all that matters. Until it doesn't again.  Lather, rinse, repeat.  We've had an especially long run of fraud and accounting not mattering.  Change coming soon.  #Corpgov

name: Probes Reporter¬Æ
tweet: In March 2009, Bernie #Madoff pled guilty to 11 federal felonies.  How many perp walks of corporate fraudsters have we seen since then?  Virtually none.  Politics.  The embarrassment to the SEC, followed by a light-touch  Trump admin, made it open season for corporate fraudsters.

name: Probes Reporter¬Æ

name: Probes Reporter¬Æ
tweet: $BABA keeps disclosing the SEC inquiry because management judges it remains a material exposure. Yet, by not providing even the scantest of updates, they are also making the willful decision to keep investors in the dark on this very same material risk. This is a Disclosure Game.

name: Probes Reporter¬Æ
tweet: That $BABA 20-F filed in July 2020, is a 508 page PDF document. Of those 508 pages, just one paragraph - 9 lines, 159 words - was devoted to the SEC inquiry.  Worse, the Jul-2020 filing repeats in form and substance what's been disclosed since May-2016, with no useful updates.

name: Probes Reporter¬Æ
tweet: The last time $BABA even spoke of its now-protracted SEC investigation was in its 20-F.  That was filed in July 2020.  The company's made 18 SEC filings since.  17 of them are 6-K's, 1 is an S-8 registration.  Not one of them has said anything about SEC investigative activity.

name: Probes Reporter¬Æ
tweet: Let's start here:  Shoddy disclosures.  We published this report on 26-May-2016,  just after $BABA first disclosed an SEC probe. We could publish nearly the exact same report today, over 4 years later, as there have been no useful updates.   https://t.co/mIl7iyFms0  $BABA

name: Probes Reporter¬Æ
tweet: Ailbaba is engaging in disclosure practices that in our opinion may be misleading, confusing, evasive, or otherwise lacking the transparency needed for investors to make well-informed investment decisions regarding a now-protracted SEC probe. We call that ‚ÄúDisclosure Games‚Äù.
